title: Richa Ghosh awarded 1 lakh per run scored in Women's WC final

The 22-year-old received a Rs 34 lakh award from the Cricket Association of Bengal for her final match performance. Cricket legends Sourav Ganguly and Jhulan Goswami lauded her significant contribution and bright future in women's cricket.

The franchise, led by Shah Rukh Khan, personally ensured Pujara received top-tier surgery in Cape Town, covering all logistics and family support, ultimately aiding his successful recovery and illustrious Test career.

He rejected claims linking the TTP's rise to the Taliban's return, stating both issues predate their takeover and stem from misguided Pakistani military actions. The Taliban asserted Pakistan's instability is an internal matter and affirmed their commitment to preventing cross-border militancy.

description: Delhi's air quality has entered the 'red zone' with AQI crossing 400, making it the country's second most polluted city. Despite hazardous levels in several areas, Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) Stage 3 has not been enforced due to comparatively better air quality this November than last year, attributed to coordinated pollution control measures.

description: Dhruv Jurel achieved a rare feat by scoring centuries in both innings of an 'A-Test' against South Africa A, becoming just the second Indian to do so. His composed 127* helped India A extend their lead significantly. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant retired hurt but returned to play a brisk 65, easing fitness concerns ahead of the upcoming Test series.

title: Priyanka Chopra makes musical comeback with desi version of Last Christmas; netizens call it ‘cringe’. Watch
Inside Bengaluru jail: Rapist, criminals seen using phones, watching TV; probe on
description: Videos have emerged showing convicted serial rapist Umesh Reddy and terror case accused Tarun Raju using mobile phones and other privileges inside Bengaluru's Parappana Agrahara Central Jail. The Karnataka Prison Department has launched an investigation into how the inmates accessed the devices and if prison officials were complicit, with strict action promised if lapses are found.

Big relief! Rishabh Pant eases injury fears after retiring hurt; returns to bat
description: India A captain Rishabh Pant returned to bat after retiring hurt due to multiple blows from a pacer. This eased injury concerns for the team management and fans ahead of the upcoming Test series against South Africa. Pant's resilience signals his readiness for the crucial home Tests.

title: 'No proof of Sita’s birthplace’: Congress digs up old BJP remark; demands PM's apology
description: Congress slammed PM Modi's Sitamarhi rally, citing a 2017 culture ministry statement denying historical proof of Goddess Sita's birth there. Jairam Ramesh demanded an apology, accusing the BJP of neglecting Bihar's religious sites and cancelling a key rail project. Meanwhile, Amit Shah announced an Rs 850-crore Sita temple project for the region.

title: Delhi govt launches ‘School Web App’; digital leap for schools; education gets smarter
description: The Delhi government has launched the School Web App, a comprehensive digital platform designed to transform how schools operate and deliver education. Introduced by Education Minister Ashish Sood, the initiative aligns with the Digital India and Viksit Bharat 2047 vision, aiming to enhance transparency, efficiency, and accessibility. While the app promises seamless communication and accountability, challenges such as the digital divide, cybersecurity, and over-reliance on technology highlight the need for balanced and inclusive implementation.

title: 12 years after UP farmer’s murder, family of nine — including 5 women — sentenced to life
Pak army spooked: Munir moves to grab more power; did Op Sindoor trigger panic?
description: Pakistan is fortifying its military command structure by tabling a constitutional amendment, citing lessons from India tensions. The move aims to formally enshrine the ranks of service chiefs and potentially create a 'Commander of Defence Forces,' raising concerns about increased military power over civilian government.

title: Gaza ceasefire: Khan Younis hospital receives 15 bodies from Israel; aid still delayed
description: Under the US-brokered ceasefire, Gaza's Nasser Hospital received 15 Palestinian bodies from Israel, following the return of an Israeli hostage's remains. This exchange adheres to an agreement where Israel returns 15 Palestinian bodies for each Israeli hostage released. The deal also mandates increased aid to Gaza, though a significant portion remains unadmitted.

title: Pak on brink of hunger crisis? Flour shortage deepens; prices hit the roof
description: Pakistan's twin cities face a severe flour shortage as wheat supplies to mills halt, sparking panic and raising food security concerns.  Prices have doubled, impacting bakers and consumers.  Compounding the crisis are transport blockades and dwindling water levels, creating a dire situation for millions.

title: UPS and FedEx grounding MD-11 planes following deadly Kentucky crash

'Fighting Mahatma's battle': Priyanka targets PM Modi; calls for 'change' in Bihar
description: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra stated that the Congress and Mahagathbandhan are fighting for citizens' rights and democracy, drawing parallels to Mahatma Gandhi's struggle against an 'empire of Narendra Modi.' She accused the BJP of attempting to weaken the Constitution and 'steal' votes, amid ongoing opposition claims of electoral manipulation.

Meanwhile, Erika Kirk appealed for public grace following her husband's passing, emphasizing the impact of online discourse on her children.

Experts warn that while ANC tech can reduce volume needs, prolonged use and potential pressure can pose serious health risks. Users are urged to monitor usage duration and volume levels to protect ear health.

description: The Trump administration has launched 175 investigations into alleged H-1B visa program abuse, aiming to protect American jobs. These probes have uncovered over $15 million in unpaid wages and numerous violations, including fake worksites and underpaid foreign workers. The administration asserts these measures will prevent wage suppression and prioritize American workers.

Klay Thompson apologises to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
description: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: 'Three targets': UK gave Canada intel on Nijjar killing; shocking claim in documentary
Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle drops ‘Oilers Collection 03’ racing-inspired line
description: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, has unveiled "Oilers Collection 03," a new capsule inspired by classic motorsport style. The collection blends the Oilers' iconic colors with high-end streetwear and automotive aesthetics, drawing from vintage racing suits and team heritage. Kyle shared a preview on Instagram, highlighting the performance-driven fashion.

title: Marshawn Kneeland’s ‘goodbye’ text hours before death highlights NFL crisis
description: Marshawn Kneeland’s death at 24 has forced the NFL to confront a serious mental health crisis. Police confirmed the Dallas Cowboys defensive end died by an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound after alarming messages to family. Coaches, teammates, and fans are grieving as dispatch audio reveals the severity of his final hours. Full details inside.

title: Caitlin Clark turns heads at Butler Bulldogs game with new Indiana Fever coach Rob Dosier
description: Caitlin Clark was spotted at a Butler University basketball game during her WNBA offseason, accompanied by new Indiana Fever player development coach Rob Dosier. Clark's presence was unsurprising due to her boyfriend's coaching role at Butler. This outing comes as Clark recovers from an injury-plagued season and prepares for a golf tournament.

title: ‘Not about compensation’: Twitter founder defends Musk’s $1Tn pay; quotes Tesla’s old post
description: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey has publicly supported Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed $1 trillion pay package. Dorsey stated the compensation is about ensuring a principled engineering approach for the company's future. This support comes as Tesla shareholders prepare to vote on the package at their annual general meeting today, November 6.

title: Future of AI: 'I would have dropped out if...'; Nvidia CEO's message to Zuckerberg
description: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.
